transforms module¶

class transforms.AxialFlip(prob=0.5)¶

Bases: transforms.Flip

Flip image along the axial axis (z-axis).

Notes

Expects input shape (X, Y, Z).

Parameters

prob (float) – The probability the flip happens. Default: 0.5

prob¶

The probability the flip happens.

Type

float

class transforms.AxialRotate(deg=(-3, 3))¶

Bases: transforms.Rotate

Rotate image’s axial axis (z-axis).

Notes

Expects input shape (X, Y, Z).

deg¶

min and max rotation angles in degrees. Randomly rotates within that range. Can be scalar, list or tuple. In case of scalar it rotates between -abs(deg) and abs(deg). Default: (-3, 3).

Type

tuple

class transforms.AxialTranslate(dist=(-3, 3))¶

Bases: transforms.Translate

Translate image along the axial axis (z-axis).

Parameters

dist (tuple) – The distance in each direction. z-axis fixed. Default: (-3,3)

Notes

Expects input shape (X, Y, Z).

class transforms.CenterCrop(size)¶

Bases: object

Crops the given 3D numpy.ndarray Image at the center.

Parameters

size (sequence/int) – Desired output size of the crop. If size is an int instead of sequence like (h, w, d), a cube crop (size, size, size) is made.

size¶

Desired output size of the crop. If size is an int instead of sequence like (h, w, d), a cube crop (size, size, size) is made.

Type

sequence/int

class transforms.Flip(axis=0, prob=0.5)¶

Bases: object

Flip the input along a given axis.

Parameters

  • axis – axis to flip over. Default: 0.

  • prob – probability to flip the image. Executes always when set to 1. Default: 0.5

axis¶

axis to flip over. Default is 0.

prob¶

probability to flip the image. Executes always when set to 1. Default: 0.5

class transforms.IntensityRescale(masked=True, on_gpu=False)¶

Bases: object

Rescale image intensities between 0 and 1 for a single image.

Parameters

  • masked (bool) – applies normalization only on non-zero voxels. Default: True.

  • on_gpu (bool) – speed up computation by using GPU. Requires torch.Tensor instead of np.array. Default: False.

masked¶

applies normalization only on non-zero voxels.

Type

bool

on_gpu¶

speed up computation by using GPU. Requires torch.Tensor instead of np.array.

Type

bool

zero_masked_transform(image)¶

Only apply transform where input is not zero.

Parameters

image – The image to transform.

Returns

Transformed image.

Return type

image

class transforms.Normalize(mean, std=1, masked=True, eps=1e-10)¶

Bases: object

Normalize tensor with first and second moments.

Notes

By default will only normalize on non-zero voxels. Set masked = False if this is undesired.

Parameters

  • mean (float) – Mean of the training data.

  • std (float) – Standard deviation of the training data. Default: 1

  • masked (bool) – Boolean switch. If True, non-zero voxels will not be normalized. Enable with value False. Default: True

  • eps (float) – Only set to scale std. Otherwise leave untouched. Default: 1e-10

mean¶

Mean of the training data.

Type

float

std¶

Standard deviation of the training data.

Type

float

masked¶

Boolean switch. If True, non-zero voxels will not be normalized. Enable with value False.

Type

bool

eps¶

Only set to scale std. Otherwise leave untouched.

Type

float

apply_transform(image)¶

Applies normalization to the image by using object attributes.

Parameters

image (torch.tensor/numpy.ndarray) – The image to normalize.

Returns

image – Normalized image.

Return type

torch.tensor/numpy.ndarray

denormalize(image)¶

Undo normalization procedure.

Parameters

image (torch.tensor/numpy.ndarray) – The image to reverse normalization for.

Returns

image – De-normalized image

Return type

torch.tensor/numpy.ndarray

zero_masked_transform(image)¶

Apply normalization transformation for non-zero voxels only.

Parameters

image (torch.tensor/numpy.ndarray) – The image to normalize.

Returns

image – Normalized image.

Return type

torch.tensor/numpy.ndarray

class transforms.Rotate(axis=0, deg=(-3, 3))¶

Bases: object

Rotate the input along a given axis.

Parameters

  • axis (int) – axis to rotate. Default is 0.

  • deg (tuple) – min and max rotation angles in degrees. Randomly rotates within that range. Can be scalar, list or tuple. In case of scalar it rotates between -abs(deg) and abs(deg). Default: (-3, 3).

axis¶

axis to rotate. Default: 0.

Type

int

deg¶

min and max rotation angles in degrees. Randomly rotates within that range. Can be scalar, list or tuple. In case of scalar it rotates between -abs(deg) and abs(deg). Default: (-3, 3).

Type

tuple

class transforms.ToTensor¶

Bases: object

Convert numpy.ndarrays to Tensors.

Notes

Expands channel axis.

Parameters

image (numpy.ndarray) – numpy.ndarray of input with dimensions H x W x Z will be transformed to torch.tensor of dimensions C x H x W x Z

image¶

numpy.ndarray of input with dimensions H x W x Z will be transformed to torch.tensor of dimensions C x H x W x Z

Type

numpy.ndarray

class transforms.Translate(axis=0, dist=(-3, 3))¶

Bases: object

Translate the input along a given axis.

Parameters

  • axis – axis to rotate. Default is 0

  • dist – min and max translation distance in pixels. Randomly translates within that range. Can be scalar, list or tuple. In case of scalar it translates between -abs(dist) and abs(dist). Default: (-3, 3).

transforms.normalization_factors(data, train_idx, shape, mode='slice')¶

Computes normalization factors for the data.

Parameters

  • data (numpy.ndarray) – The image data

  • train_idx (numpy.ndarray/list) – Training indices.

  • shape – Shape of the image data. Expected to be 3 dimensional.

  • mode (str) – Either “slice” or “voxel”. Defines the granularity of the normalization. Voxelwise normalization does not work well with linear registered data only. Default: “slice”

Raises

NotImplementedError – Unknown mode selected.

transforms.normalize_float(ndarr, min=-1)¶

Performs min-max normalization on a numpy.ndarray matrix.

Parameters

  • ndarr (numpy.ndarray) – The numpy array to normalize

  • min (int/float) – Either -1 or 0. Default: -1

Returns

norm – The min-max-normalization of the input matrix

Return type

numpy.ndarray

transforms.normalize_float_torch(x_tensor, min=-1)¶

Performs min-max normalization on a Pytorch tensor matrix.

Notes

Can also deal with Pytorch dictionaries where the data matrix key is ‘image’.

Parameters

  • ndarr (numpy.ndarray) – The numpy array to normalize

  • min (int/float) – Either -1 or 0. Default: -1

Returns

norm – The min-max-normalization of the input matrix

Return type

numpy.ndarray

nitorch
